Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-011 Which is a characteristic of sophisticated attacks?
Options:
• A. Limited to physical devices
  • B. Using common internet tools
  • C. Requiring user interaction
  • D. Slow propagation speed
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. Limited to physical devices
  • B. Using common internet tools
  • C. Requiring user interaction
  • D. Slow propagation speed
CorrectOptions:
B
Why correct: Sophisticated attacks use common internet tools to blend with legitimate traffic, making them hard to detect.
Why incorrect: Limited to physical devices applies to physical controls, not attacks; requiring user interaction is typical of older attacks, not modern sophisticated ones; slow propagation speed contradicts the rapid scale of modern attacks.
Rationale: Tests recall of a key characteristic of sophisticated attacks.
Metadata: Single-correct
Source: Section::1.1.3

Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-012 Which is a characteristic of sophisticated attacks?
Options:
• A. Using common internet tools
  • B. Restricted to local networks
  • C. Dependent on manual execution
  • D. Predictable attack patterns
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. Using common internet tools
  • B. Restricted to local networks
  • C. Dependent on manual execution
  • D. Predictable attack patterns
CorrectOptions:
A
Why correct: Sophisticated attacks use common internet tools to blend with legitimate traffic, making them hard to detect.
Why incorrect: Restricted to local networks limits attack scope, unlike internet-based sophisticated attacks; dependent on manual execution applies to less automated attacks; predictable attack patterns contradict their variable behavior.
Rationale: Tests recall of a key characteristic of sophisticated attacks.
Metadata: Single-correct
Source: Section::1.1.3

Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-017 What is the primary role of a Computer Incident Response Team (CIRT)?
Options:
• A. Developing security software
  • B. Handling security incident notifications
  • C. Conducting employee training
  • D. Monitoring network traffic
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. Developing security software
  • B. Handling security incident notifications
  • C. Conducting employee training
  • D. Monitoring network traffic
CorrectOptions:
B
Why correct: A CIRT serves as a single point of contact for the notification of security incidents.
Why incorrect: Developing security software is a developer role; conducting employee training is an HR or training function; monitoring network traffic is typically an SOC responsibility.
Rationale: Tests recall of the CIRT’s core role.
Metadata: Single-correct
Source: Section::1.1.3

Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-020 What does the "shift left" principle in DevSecOps emphasize?
Options:
• A. Delaying security until deployment
  • B. Integrating security in early development stages
  • C. Focusing on post-incident recovery
  • D. Automating network monitoring
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. Delaying security until deployment
  • B. Integrating security in early development stages
  • C. Focusing on post-incident recovery
  • D. Automating network monitoring
CorrectOptions:
B
Why correct: The "shift left" principle in DevSecOps emphasizes integrating security during the requirements and planning phases of development.
Why incorrect: Delaying security until deployment contradicts shift left; focusing on post-incident recovery is a corrective function; automating network monitoring is an SOC task, not specific to DevSecOps.
Rationale: Tests recall of the shift left principle in DevSecOps.
Metadata: Single-correct
Source: Section::1.1.3

Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-032 What is the primary purpose of deterrent controls in cybersecurity?
Options:
• A. To detect ongoing attacks
  • B. To discourage malicious actions
  • C. To restore systems after attacks
  • D. To prevent unauthorized access
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. To detect ongoing attacks
  • B. To discourage malicious actions
  • C. To restore systems after attacks
  • D. To prevent unauthorized access
CorrectOptions:
B
Why correct: Deterrent controls are designed to discourage malicious actions, such as through warnings or visible security measures.
Why incorrect: Detecting ongoing attacks is the role of detective controls; restoring systems is the role of corrective controls; preventing unauthorized access is the role of preventive controls.
Rationale: Tests recall of the purpose of deterrent controls.
Metadata: Single-correct
Source: Section::1.1.3

  • D. Fixed attack patterns

B

Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-053 Which characteristics make sophisticated attacks challenging to detect? (CHOOSE TWO)

• A. They use common internet tools
  • B. They follow fixed patterns
  • C. They vary their behavior
  • D. They rely on physical media
  • E. They require user interaction

• A. They use common internet tools
  • B. They follow fixed patterns
  • C. They vary their behavior
  • D. They rely on physical media
  • E. They require user interaction
CorrectOptions:
A, C

Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-056 A security professional uses alarms to secure a facility. Which implementation category does this represent?
Options:
• A. Managerial
  • B. Physical
  • C. Operational
  • D. Technical
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. Managerial
  • B. Physical
  • C. Operational
  • D. Technical
CorrectOptions:
B
Why correct: Alarms are non-technical physical controls used to secure facilities.
Why incorrect: Managerial controls involve oversight and policies; operational controls rely on people; technical controls involve system-based measures like encryption.
Rationale: Tests identification of the physical implementation category in a scenario.
